<<<<<<< HEAD
The court of curiositie wherein by the algebra and lot, the most intricate questions are resolved, and nocturnal dreams and visions explained according to the doctrine of the antients : to which is also added A treatise of physiognomy / published in French by Marck de Vulson ; translated into English by J.G. Vulson, Marc de, sieur de La Colombière, d. 1665. J. G., Gent.
[37], 202 p.
Printed by J.C. for William Crooke, London : 1669.
"A treatise of nocturnal dreams & visions" and "A treatise of physiognomie" each have special t.p. "The court of curiositie" is unpaged, the paging of the remaining parts continuous. Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
=======

Vulson, Marc de, sieur de La Colombière, d. 1665. J. G., Gent.
[37], 202 p.
Printed by J.C. for William Crooke, London : 1669.
"A treatise of nocturnal dreams & visions" and "A treatise of physiognomie" each have special t.p. "The court of curiositie" is unpaged, the paging of the remaining parts continuous. Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
